comments.commentBody:
this guy has to be stopped and pretty quickly. he's getting better but still not that good. I'm happily amazed how effective how jamming, spoofing or other disruptions of telemetry, seeding the supply chain and causing command and control errors has been. but you can still see the dinosaurs who maintain the effectiveness of Reagans pipe dream SDI now reduced to THADD which is itself a joke. hitting these things in boost and post-boost works but you gotta be close and quick as piece noted. left out was use of solid fuel boosters which greatly reduces launch times. it should also be noted the smaller, mobile units have obviously limited range which is good for US but bad for Seoul or Tokyo. I'm not privy to everything obviously but the guys 5-10 years easy away from ICMBs esp bc of the miniaturization which requires hi-tech CNC machines, EDM techniques, circuit design and fusing/arming/compression technologies you dont just get Radio Shack.
but the most important thing left out was that his "goals" show a trump like level of narcissism and jesus-complex. even an incompetent missile salvage- or proximity-fused to spit $50 of ball bearings can take out our spy or other satellites in short order. and loss of our "eyes in the sky" would mean we would have to proceed like people did before they had "smart phones" to tell them how to get to Starbucks a block away and level the place with sub-launched cruise missile and actual strategic bombers hopefully before Seoul is rubble.
China took out one of it's own satellites to demonstrate the feasibility of what they can do. I don't think they would sit idly by if we take military action.
Uh IT Security Engineer here.  Thats the dumbest thing I've ever heard :D

The latest controversy initiated by President Donald Trump in a 7:02am Saturday morning Tweet raises several possibilities:

1) This is another diversionary attempt to deflect attention from an uncomfortable situation of growing public concern about a Trump-Russia connection.

2) This is another example of Trump’s ignorance about how our government works – in this case how wiretaps are obtained by getting a court warrant.

3) This is another example of how thin-skinned and impetuous President Trump is, as evident from the fact that his Tweet was sent without deliberating with his staff.

4) This is another demonstration of the strong influence of Stephen K. Bannon, because the Tweet apparently followed unsubstantiated musings of far right fake news outlets.

5) All of the above.

Democrats and reality-based journalists need to hold firm and to keep the pressure on. They need also avoid following every bright, shiny object Donald Trump throws down the rat hole.

45 has no common sense, he lies, he's unstable, insecure, paranoid and has the emotional capabilities of a 3 year old. He's not fit to serve as Commander-in-Chief. His tantrums could get us into serious world conflicts.

His pronouncements cancelling restrictions on water and emissions will destroy the health of the planet. He doesn't understand the intricacies of trade.

The Republican party apparatus and members of Congress are coddling him and riding on his coattails hope to get their agendas passed. Shame on them!
Trump needs to be punished when he broadcast baseless accusations.  Can't people sue him or something?  All of America should not be reduced to Steve Bannon's internet.

Go to our regional allies, inform them that this cannot go on, and that we intend to destabilise the NK regime starting soon, w/ the goal being regime change w/in 5 years. Get them on board, if possible.

Then go to China, tell them the current situation is untenable and offer them two alternatives: they help us overthrow the current regime and reunify Korea by withdrawing economic aid, and we will begin to withdraw our troops; or we will immediately begin active destabilisation efforts.

Then begin using drones, balloons, and other methods to shower NK with money ($20s), DVDs, flash drives, radios, guns, etc., just like we supplied the French Resistance in WWII. Start placing phone calls to government and military officials warning them their days are numbered. Infiltrate agents, etc.

The regime will stress out and begin to crumble. China may freak out, but let them. China may even invade NK. Let them. It would be better than what we have now.
Now that's a movie I would watch
Hate to break it to you, but ALL of your ideas have been used for at least a decade.  To no effect.
This crazy and yes, a diversion.  He needs to keep Russia out of our mouths and minds of America.   Fe Fi Fo Fum, ever closer impeachment comes!

Armed intervention is not going to happen.   No one is going to fight and die to save these people from themselves, and fighting and dying is what it would take.    The nations of the West have little tolerance for taking casualties.   Maybe 70 years ago, in WWII, tens of thousands of dead and injured were considered acceptable, but today we declare a quagmire as soon as a couple of dozen of our soldiers are killed.

Hmmm...

So let's suppose that the government had good reason to tap his phone because evidence presented before the FISA court deemed such action appropriate.

Then, let's suppose there really is something Trump is afraid may have been overheard.

Then, let's suppose that this starts to come out.

Seems to me Trump is preparing us for that possibility so that he can claim that the wire tap was worse than his offense.

To use a golf metaphor that no doubt Trump is familiar with: par for the course.

Right! Its really dumb to push the investigations in this direction. Politically ignorant and strategically stupid, to want more attention on the ever more real connections between his Camp, maybe even himself (there could be a random call out there that that he make and he failed to disclose) and the Russians. Russians who are way smarter then he and his Camp in these political shenanigans could have set him/they up for these distractions, by simply making random contacts, that they'd know a man with way too much self-confidence, compounded by a real lack of knowledge of the laws governing these matters, would mess the bed once in office.

Thereby giving the Russians a lot more room to operate out in the world, while the US is distracted by their inept, politically naive and over-sold Prez, and his band of collective neophytes.

Unlike many of the bad actors in the world, like Russia, the US is easily distracted by domestic political scandals, that Trump is fully helping to catch real fire.
Perhaps it should be looked into,  "What businesses does Trump own or control in Russia?"

Let's suppose let's suppose let's suppose. That about sums it up. You do realize that the word "suppose" can here be replaced with "pretend" or "fantasize." Here's an idea. Let's stick to evidence. If we criticize Trump for assertions without evidence, let's criticize the media for its Russia Hacking obsession, which is also an assertion now taken as bedrock truth by most, without a shred of evidence.
Gimmes were PIE CHART, GASLIGHT, VICE VERSA, and I think that was about it.  This took much longer than usual but was well worth the time.
It's time for the media to stop being distracted by the tweets. I don't care, give me the real news. Your constant comments on his tweets are what gave him free publicity throughout the election.
I feel exhausted like you Bradford. This morning I actually went grocery shopping with my wife. I haven't done that for 20 years.

So "president" trump shot off his mouth/thumbs with another weird Twitter tirade. So what? This is normal behavior from this abnormal man. The real story is: what will it take for the GOP Congress and senate to show up and serve the American people, and not just their careers? Inexcusable that their collective approach is silence.
And where are those tax returns, hmm...?

Reckless? Nope. The record shows the Obama Admin went twice to the FISA for permission to tap. Once was denied and once was approved. The fact is there.

Or are you denying Obama went to the FISA court even though there is record of it?

More here:
https://californiajimmy.com/2017/03/04/trump-accuses-obama-wire-tapping-...

I just listened to Levin. Talk about logical fallacies. He argues that Sessions' meetings with the Russian Ambassador were harmless, therefore Sessions should not recuse himself. However, the issue is that he lied under oath to Congress. That is a crime; we all saw him do it, and he has admitted that his testimony was incorrect. Nobody has even gotten to the next part of the argument. Levin is misleading the audience on this issue.

As one reporter noted, Trump has the ability to be the best informed person in the entire world. He has every resource. What is he doing gathering national security intelligence from a radio show performer who is obfuscating, misleading, and rabble rousing the public? It is beyond pathetic and beyond incompetent.

Next Trump fell back to Breitbart to back for verification of his fake news (lies). Really? This clarifies why Steve Bannon should be thrown out on his rear. It is a propaganda outlet not a news source and it stated Levin's claims (not facts) without evidence, again, deliberately misleading the public for nefarious purposes.

This is what you get when you elect someone who won't read the newspapers, or the security briefings, and won't ask intelligent questions of sources who might be well informed.

Trump is flailing, grasping at straws, and as others have suggested, moving his little hands so quickly because he needs to conceal the ball. Watch carefully.
I wonder if Obama can sue for libel.  Not DJT as president but the Real Donald Trump who sent those tweets.  I'd love to see that.
no he cant

The statement by Obama*s spokesman was exquisitely parsed, sort of on a par with the "meaning of what 'is' is."

Considering the expansion of the Big Brother State under Obama for whom I voted twice-yes-twice, and his administration's ferocious pursuit of whistleblowers and investigative journalists, I'd say the lines between good guys and bad guys have been thoroughly smudged.

His support of Hillary's campaign was all show and no substance, and mostly served to emphasize and underscore how popular he and Michelle remain (are you watching, publishers? Yeah, we sure are!). Not much of a cavalry response to the hysteria about "the Russians hacked the election!" Which they didn't. They hacked the DNC and no one but no one has disputed the authenticity of any of those emails.

The truth here is likely that interceptions were of Russian conversations with parties in Trump Tower, rather than of Trump crew conversations with the Russians. Crucial difference when it comes to plausible deniability but the end result is the same. Trump's lousy at expressing himself but sometimes he hits the bullseye anyway.

The Democrats ought to wisen up. Trump isn't a Republican, but the clever Republicans are embracing him. Democrats need to forget about all those raw bleeding wounds. Get in the door while you can.

"Where trouble melts like lemon drops
High above the chimney top
That's where you'll find me
Oh, somewhere over the rainbow bluebirds fly
And the dream that you dare to,..."

It's all way too surreal, man. Lemme outta here... except this is real.

In every sense of the word, this is real, we have a dangerously incompetent President. I'm scared.
Oh yes! The "REAL" story here is that whistle blowers should be punished, NOT the people breaking the law in the first place.  Let's keep our priorities straight.

Obama also at first denied his administration bugged the phone of our European allies.

Obama lied then, to our allies, to the world, but you believe him now?
Please wake me up. This isn't reality, just a nightmare.

Please when is this clown show over?
And republican silence in the face of repeated nonsense is deafening.

Trump has been bullying, duping, cheating, and stiffing people all his life. He has a standard MO down. When people start to get close to seeing what he's actually been doing, but before he's actually exposed, he goes on a defensive attack.

This preempts and blunts what's coming at him, sometimes deflects it, and mitigates the damage when he's exposed. Everything he does is nasty and evil - like a cartoon character he can't help himself - so he's always on the edge of scandal and verging on exposure, always ready to lash out. We can't even imagine the depth of his sickness.

Like clockwork, whenever he attacks for no apparent reason and seems unhinged, it's because he's preparing to be exposed.

He then blames the accuser. This ain't no John Wayne.

Proof shpoof.  Neither trump nor his legion of the credulous require substantiation of any kind. Only his enemies run around screaming for proof because they're trying to bring him down! This is real Capt. Queeg stuff. What a contemptible spectacle we have in the White House. Please, somebody make it go away.

Whatever humanness resulted for Trump Tuesday evening, and I am quick to say "much". It was completely lost with this latest stupid and lying twitter !! It has become absolutely obvious that Trump is mentally sick and needs to see a first-rate psychiatrist. He is not sane enough for the job he was elected to fill. Some Senators and Reps must become honest themselves and ACT appropriately. I fear for our great ( yes, it is, Mr. Trump ) nation if this does not take place. God ( Of Jews, Christians, and Moslems ) deliver us from the downfall Trump and associates seem to be leading us. Yes, Trump and the present White House associates are leading us to that point.
What if projection coincides with paranoia?  Where can that take a person?
